LanguageData.Plant_ShrubLow.label: low shrubs
LanguageData.Plant_ShrubLow.description: Various low broadleaf shrubs. These grow in clusters and slow down movement.
LanguageData.Plant_Alocasia.label: alocasia
LanguageData.Plant_Alocasia.description: A tropical plant. Its extremely broad leaves are a commonly-recognized signifier of tropical forests.
LanguageData.Plant_Clivia.label: clivia
LanguageData.Plant_Clivia.description: An unusual plant with tall, pretty flowers. Some call it the 'bush lily'.
LanguageData.Plant_Rafflesia.label: giant rafflesia
LanguageData.Plant_Rafflesia.description: A rare, giant flower which can be found deep in steaming jungles. You would think a giant flower would be beautiful, but this one looks and smells like rotting flesh.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeTeak.label: teak tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeTeak.description: An exceptionally strong hardwood tree that grows in warm climates. Because teak wood is so durable and water-resistant, it was used to form the keel of wooden sailing ships in ancient times.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeCecropia.label: cecropia tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeCecropia.description: One of the most common rainforest trees. Cecropia grows very fast, but yields little usable wood.
LanguageData.Plant_TreePalm.label: palm tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreePalm.description: A tropical tree with a tall, naked trunk topped by a cluster of very broad leaves. Unfortunately, this variety doesn't produce any edible coconuts.
LanguageData.Plant_TreeBamboo.label: bamboo tree
LanguageData.Plant_TreeBamboo.description: A fast-growing tree-like plant that grows in dense groves. Bamboo can be harvested for a wood-like material. The plant itself is not beautiful.
